content: Government of Singapore from 2020 to 2024 The **Fifth Cabinet of [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong)** of the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) was announced on 25 July 2020 following the [2020 general election](/wiki/2020_Singaporean_general_election) on 10 July, and came into effect on 27 July 2020. ## Changes There was one new Minister appointed, with two outgoing Ministers. [Khaw Boon Wan](/wiki/Khaw_Boon_Wan) retired from politics while [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng) stepped down after losing in the 2020 general election. MinistersIncomingOutgoing[Tan See Leng](/wiki/Tan_See_Leng)[Minister of Manpower](/wiki/Minister_of_Manpower_(Singapore)) and Second Minister for Trade and Industry[Khaw Boon Wan](/wiki/Khaw_Boon_Wan)Coordinating Minister for Infrastructure and Minister at [Ministry of Transport (Singapore)](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore))[Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng)Minister in the [Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)) ## Composition ### Cabinet The list of Cabinet ministers and other office holders was announced on 25 July 2020. In a press conference, [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) said, "I'm rotating the ministers, especially the younger ones, to gain exposure and experience. We regularly do this during Cabinet shuffles, and the intent is to expose the office-holders to different portfolios to gain both breadth and depth to understand the intricacies of the issues, and to see things from different perspectives." Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) - [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong) (Second Minister) [Manpower](/wiki/Ministry_of_Manpower_(Singapore)) (MOM) - [Josephine Teo](/wiki/Josephine_Teo) - [Tan See Leng](/wiki/Tan_See_Leng) (Second Minister) [National Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Development_(Singapore)) (MND) - [Desmond Lee](/wiki/Desmond_Lee_(Singaporean_politician)) - [Indranee Rajah](/wiki/Indranee_Rajah) (Second Minister) [Social and Family Development](/wiki/Ministry_of_Social_and_Family_Development) (MSF) - [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) - [Desmond Lee](/wiki/Desmond_Lee_(Singaporean_politician)) (Minister-in-charge of Social Services Integration) [Sustainability and Environment](/wiki/Ministry_of_Sustainability_and_the_Environment) (MSE) - [Grace Fu](/wiki/Grace_Fu) [Trade and Industry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Trade_and_Industry_(Singapore)) (MTI) - [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing) - [S. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) (Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations) - [Tan See Leng](/wiki/Tan_See_Leng) (Second Minister) [Transport](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore)) (MOT) - [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) ### 15 May 2021–12 June 2022 On 8 April 2021, [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) had announced that he was stepping aside as the 4G Leader citing "age" and "health" concerns. He also stated that he would relinquish his finance portfolio in the upcoming Cabinet reshuffle. As such, a Cabinet reshuffle occurred on 23 April 2021 where [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) was announced to take over [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) as Finance Minister. 6 other Ministers were also rotated. Heng however continued to stay on as Deputy Prime Minister as well as Coordinating Minister. As of 15 May 2021 MinistryMinisters[Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)) (PMO) - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) (Prime Minister) - [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) (Deputy Prime Minister and Coordinating Minister for Economic Policies) - [Teo Chee Hean](/wiki/Teo_Chee_Hean) (Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security) - [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) (Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies) - [Indranee Rajah](/wiki/Indranee_Rajah) (Minister) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Minister) [Communications and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Communications_and_Information) (MCI) - [Josephine Teo](/wiki/Josephine_Teo) (Minister-in-charge of the Smart Nation Initiative & the Cyber Security Agency) [Culture, Community and Youth](/wiki/Ministry_of_Culture,_Community_and_Youth) (MCCY) - [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong) [Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)) (MINDEF) - [Ng Eng Hen](/wiki/Ng_Eng_Hen) [Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) (MOE) - [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Second Minister) [Finance](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Singapore)) (MOF) - [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) - [Indranee Rajah](/wiki/Indranee_Rajah) (Second Minister) [Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) (MFA) - [Vivian Balakrishnan](/wiki/Vivian_Balakrishnan) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Second Minister) [Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) (MOH) - [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) - [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) (Second Minister) [Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) (MHA) - [K. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) (Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations) ### As of 13 June 2022 On 14 April 2022, [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) was selected as the next 4G Leader, succeeding [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat). Thus a Cabinet reshuffle was announced on 6 June 2022 and carried out exactly a week later on 13 June 2022 where [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) was promoted to Deputy Prime Minister and Acting Prime Minister in the Prime Minister's Absence. Lawrence also assumed responsibility of the Strategy Group in the PMO from [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat). As of 13 June 2022 MinistryMinisters[Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)) (PMO) - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) (Prime Minister) - [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) (Deputy Prime Minister) - [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) (Deputy Prime Minister and Coordinating Minister for Economic Policies) - [Teo Chee Hean](/wiki/Teo_Chee_Hean) (Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for National Security) - [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) (Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies) - [Indranee Rajah](/wiki/Indranee_Rajah) (Minister) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Minister) [Communications and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Communications_and_Information) (MCI) - [Josephine Teo](/wiki/Josephine_Teo) (Minister-in-charge of the Smart Nation Initiative & the Cyber Security Agency) [Culture, Community and Youth](/wiki/Ministry_of_Culture,_Community_and_Youth) (MCCY) - [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong) [Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)) (MINDEF) - [Ng Eng Hen](/wiki/Ng_Eng_Hen) [Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) (MOE) - [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Second Minister) [Finance](/wiki/Ministry_of_Finance_(Singapore)) (MOF) - [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) - [Indranee Rajah](/wiki/Indranee_Rajah) (Second Minister) [Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) (MFA) - [Vivian Balakrishnan](/wiki/Vivian_Balakrishnan) - [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman) (Second Minister) [Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) (MOH) - [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) - [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) (Second Minister) [Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) (MHA) - [K. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) (Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations) ### As of 18 January 2024 [S. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran) resigned as Transport Minister, Member of Parliament, and member of the People's Action Party on 16 January 2024, two days before he pleaded not guilty to 27 charges of obtaining gratification as a public servant, corruption, and obstructing justice. Thus, [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat) was promoted to [Minister of Transport](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore)) and [Grace Fu](/wiki/Grace_Fu) assumed responsibility as Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations on 18 January 2024 from [S. Iswaran](/wiki/S._Iswaran). title: Fifth Lee Hsien Loong Cabinet
